meanings.definition: A heavy wheel that stores rotational energy and smooths the operation of a machine.
meanings.sent1: The flywheel on the old tractor helped keep the engine running smoothly.
meanings.sent2: The mechanic explained how the flywheel stores energy to keep the machine running.
meanings.sent3: The flywheel joked with the gears, 'I'm the heavy lifter around here!'
meanings.sent4: Her determination was like a flywheel, storing energy to overcome any obstacle.
meanings.sent5: The shiny flywheel gleamed in the sunlight, a symbol of the machine's power.

meanings.definition: A wheel that spins rapidly to maintain the speed of an engine during changes in load.
meanings.sent1: The flywheel on the engine spun quickly to keep the speed constant.
meanings.sent2: During the race, the flywheel ensured the engine didn't slow down.
meanings.sent3: The flywheel chuckled, 'I never slow down, even when things get tough!'
meanings.sent4: Time seemed to slow down, like a flywheel maintaining the engine's speed.
meanings.sent5: The flywheel hummed with power, a constant force in the engine's operation.
